hr.fer.zemris.java.gui.calc

Class CalculatorMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.gui.calc.CalculatorMemory

  • public class CalculatorMemory
extends java.lang.Object

    Calculator memory used to store calculation data.

    Should be used with CalculatorButton for commands, input and querries. Use set current to reset the input and set the screen to the given number. Use updateCurrent with string containing a single digit. No screens are set by default and should be given with addScreens. SetOperation method should be used to set the next operation to be performed on the stored numbers. SwitchInverse() should be used before calculate() or setCurrent() if inverse operation is desired. Reset resets the stack and all internally stored operations and variables.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Juraj Pejnovic
    See Also:
    Calculator, CalculatorButton

      • setOperations

        public void setOperations(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function,
                          java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> inverseFunction)
        Sets the next operation to be perfomed and it's inverse operation. If no inverse operation exists the same operation should be given. Inverse operation will be performed if inverse flag is set by switchInverse. Inverse can be checked by isInversed method. After giving operations, a new input should be given. First operand is the input before giving the operations and second operand is given after givin operation.
        Parameters:
        function - function to be performed
        inverseFunction - inverse of the function if exists, function otherwise

      • calculate

        public void calculate()
        Calculates the saved operation given by the setOperations method. Retains the operation and second operand afterwards.
